answers.author: Tess Heffernan
answers.text:
The City of Fort Collins, Colorado is now using Baldrige.  We completed an organizational profile in 2010 and in May 2011 we'll be submitting a "Foothills" level application to Colorado Performance Excellence.  We are a full service city with 2000 employees (1,200 FTEs) serving a population of 145,000.  
Would you please share your list of 8 cities?  We, too, have been looking for other whole municipalities embarking on this process.

Bill – Coral Springs, FL won the Baldrige Award in 2008 (http://www.coralsprings.org/baldrige/index.cfm) ; the only city to ever get a Baldrige Award.  Washoe County, NV has been preparing for the Baldrige Award for some time and are getting closer to being the first County.  If interested, contact Katy Simon, Washoe County Manager at (775) 328-2000 or ksimon@washoecounty.us
This link may be helpful - http://www.baldrigepe.org/alliance/ - the Alliance for Performance Excellence

answers.author: Richard Michaud
answers.text:
William,
I am very interested in the answers your receive to this question.  The City of Saco, Maine is the only municipality using his model in this state.  If you know of local governments in other states using this approach I would be interested in such a list.  I am on the ICMA Planning Committee and have agreed to assist with a Baldrige session at the annual meeting.  I am looking for a small community and a large one to speak to the criteria of leadership as well as an examiner with local government experience to speak to this criteria.  Do you have any suggestions?
Monday of this week the City Council adopted the attached policy linking permanence based pay to the Baldrige criteria.  
Saco will have a 3rd draft of the application by the end of the month.  If you would like to see a copy please let me know.

author: William Follette
text:
I would like to know if any municipalities are using the proven business model encapsulated in the Baldrige Criteria for Performance Excellence for managing and improving their organization.  So far, I have talked to eight cities/towns that are doing so but would like to find more if they exist.  
I know that there are numerous individual city/county departments that are doing so, but I would like to restrict my research to whole municipalities.
title: Baldrige Business Model
